sentence: I'll stay up all night to finish this project.我會熬夜完成這個計畫。

definition: to glance or take a brief look at something
sentence: Can you take a look at this and tell me what's wrong?你能看一下這個，告訴我出了什麼問題嗎?

definition: to pause or stop an activity in order to rest
sentence: I'm going to take a rest after finishing this project.我完成這個項目後會休息一下。

definition: to take a leisurely walk, typically for recreation or exercise
sentence: I love to take a walk in the park on Sundays.我喜歡在星期天散步公园。

definition: to resemble or be similar to someone or something
sentence: My sister takes after our mother, with her striking blue eyes.我的姐姐像我們母親一樣，有著深藍色的眼睛。

definition: to remove or confiscate something, especially from a place or situation
sentence: I don't want to take away your chance to speak.我不想拿走你的發言機會。

definition: to take precautions to ensure someone's safety or well-being
sentence: Take care, I'll see you tomorrow.小心、明天我再見你。

definition: to look after someone or something, to take responsibility for their care and well-being
sentence: I will take care of the kids while you're away.我會照顧孩子們你外出時。

definition: to remove something from a surface, or to start flying
sentence: The pilot took off the plane as scheduled.機師按時脫下了飛機。

definition: to remove something from a container or location
sentence: I'll take out the trash tonight.我今天晚上會拿出垃圾。

definition: to assume control or management of something
sentence: The new CEO decided to take over the company's marketing department.新任CEO決定接管公司的市場部門。

definition: to join in an activity or event, often as a participant or contributor.
sentence: She decided to take part in the charity run to support her friend's cause.她決定參加慈善跑步以支持朋友的義務。

definition: to spend time on something or to make an effort to do something slowly and carefully
sentence: I'll take my time to finish this project.我會花時間完成這個項目。

definition: to do something in regular intervals, with each person or thing having a turn
sentence: We take turns playing soccer and tennis.我們輪流玩足球和網球。

definition: to discuss something thoroughly, especially about a particular topic or issue
sentence: They spent hours talking over the project's details.他們花了幾小時討論項目的細節。

definition: to engage in conversation with someone
sentence: I like to talk to my friends about their hobbies.我喜歡跟朋友們討論他們的嗜好。

definition: to wear something for a short time to see how it fits or looks
to change direction or turn back in order to face a different way
sentence: I had to turn around and go back home.我需要轉身回家。

definition: to change one's direction or course; to return to a previous position or state.
sentence: I had to turn back because I forgot my keys at home.我因為忘記了家裡的鑰匙所以要轉回。

definition: to reduce the volume of sound
sentence: I'll turn down the music, please.我會調小聲音，請你。

definition: to become something or someone else
sentence: She turned into a famous actress after winning the award.她變成了一位著名的演員，贏得了獎後。

definition: to switch off or disconnect from a power source
sentence: Can you turn off the TV when you're done?你可以關掉電視吧？

definition: to make something, especially an electrical device, function or operate.
sentence: I need to turn on the lights in my room.我需要在我的房間裡打開燈。

definition: to increase in volume or intensity; to appear or emerge
sentence: The music started to turn up as the party got going.酒吧開始熱鬧，音樂開始出現、調高。

definition: to become awake or alert, typically after a period of sleep or unconsciousness
sentence: I woke up feeling refreshed and ready to start the day.我醒來後感到疲累，準備開始新的一天。

definition: to solve a problem or achieve something through effort and perseverance
sentence: I'll work out the solution to this puzzle.我將鍛鍊這個謎題的答案。

definition: to respond to someone by letter or message, typically in a formal or official capacity
sentence: I'll write back as soon as I can.我會立即回信。

definition: to record or express something in writing, especially by hand
sentence: I will write down the recipe for my favorite cake.我將寫下我的最愛蛋糕的食譜。

definition: to prepare a written report or summary
sentence: The journalist was asked to write up the story for the next day's newspaper.記者被要求為明日的報紙寫報告

definition: A tool with a toothed blade used for cutting hard substances, in particular wood or metal
sentence: I saw a shooting star last night.昨晚我看見了一顆流星。She saw her favorite singer in the crowd.她在人群中看見了她最喜歡的歌手。

word: I saw it on the advertisement.
definition: I saw it on the advertisement.
sentence: I saw it on the advertisement.我在廣告看見的。When I was flipping through the magazine, I saw it on the advertisement.當我翻閱雜誌時，我在廣告看見的。

word: I never go to ancient China.
definition: I do not visit ancient China.
sentence: I never go to ancient China.我從未去過古代中國。My friend loves visiting historical sites, but I never go to ancient China.我朋友喜歡參觀歷史遺跡，但我從未去過古代中國。

definition: Express regret or say sorry to her.
sentence: Please apologize to her for your rude behavior yesterday.昨天你的粗魯行為，請向她道歉。Could you please apologize to her for the misunderstanding?你能否為這次誤會向她道歉？

definition: "Why you force me?" means asking why someone is pressuring or compelling you to do something.
sentence: Why you force me? I don't want to do it if I'm not ready.你為什麼逼我？如果我還沒準備好，我就不想做。Why you force me? It's important to respect each other's boundaries.為什麼逼我？尊重彼此的界限是很重要的。

definition: Your physical look is unattractive or unpleasant.
sentence: Your appearance so ugly makes it hard for people to look at you.你的外表真醜讓人很難看你。Despite your appearance so ugly, your kindness shines through.儘管你的外表真醜，你的善良仍然閃耀著。

definition: Expressing gratitude for help or support provided.
sentence: Thank you for your assistance.謝謝你的幫助。I want to express my gratitude for your assistance.我想對你的幫助表示感謝。

definition: A collision involving a vehicle resulting in damage or injury.
sentence: I have a car accident.我出了車禍。After I have a car accident, I will need to contact my insurance company.發生車禍後，我必須聯繫我的保險公司。

definition: I own the house.
sentence: The house belongs to me, so please do not enter without permission.這間房子屬於我的，所以請不要未經允許而進入。I inherited the house from my grandparents, so yes, the house belongs to me.這間房子是我從祖父母那裡繼承來的，所以是的，這間房子屬於我的。

definition: You are impolite or disrespectful in your behavior or speech.
sentence: You are so rude.你真沒禮貌。I can't believe you just said that! You are so rude.我真不敢相信你剛才說了那句話！你真沒禮貌。

definition: A person who is popular, especially at a school.
sentence: The movie is very popular among teenagers.這部電影在青少年中非常受歡迎。The new restaurant in town is already popular with the locals.鎮上的新餐廳已經受當地人的歡迎。

definition: Many people like and know him.
sentence: He is a popular person, everyone wants to be his friend.他是一個受歡迎的人，每個人都想成為他的朋友。Being a popular person, he is often invited to social events.作為一個受歡迎的人，他常常被邀請參加社交活動。

definition: (in a person) The state of being calm; peacefulness; absence of worry, anger, fear or other strong negative emotion.
sentence: The teacher remained calm during the student's outburst.老師在學生的突然爆發時保持冷靜。Despite the chaos around him, he stayed calm and composed.儘管周圍一片混亂，他保持冷靜和沉著。
I love taking a walk around the campus in the evening.我喜歡在傍晚時分在校園裡散步。The campus is buzzing with students preparing for the upcoming exams.校園裡充滿了為即將到來的考試做準備的學生。

definition: Money in the form of notes/bills and coins, as opposed to cheques/checks or electronic transactions.
sentence: I prefer to pay with cash rather than credit cards.我寧願用現金支付，而不是信用卡。The store only accepts cash for purchases under $10.這家商店只接受購買金額在10美元以下的現金。

definition: A place that promotes and celebrates the arts, traditions, and customs of a particular group or community.
sentence: The culture center offers various workshops and events to promote local arts and traditions.文化中心提供各種工作坊和活動，以推廣當地的藝術和傳統。Many tourists visit the culture center to learn about the rich history and heritage of the region.許多遊客造訪文化中心，了解這個地區豐富的歷史和遺產。

definition: A period of 100 consecutive years; often specifically a numbered period with conventional start and end dates, e.g., the twentieth century, which stretches from (strictly) 1901 through 2000, or (informally) 1900 through 1999. The first century AD was from 1 to 100.
sentence: The 20th century saw many technological advancements.20世紀見證了許多科技的進步。The Great Wall of China was built over many centuries.中國的長城是在許多世紀內建造的。

definition: A confrontation; a dare.
sentence: Facing a difficult challenge can be a great opportunity for personal growth.面對一個困難的挑戰可以是個促進個人成長的絕佳機會。She decided to take on the challenge of learning a new language.她決定接受學習一種新語言的挑戰。

definition: Complex music composed for orchestras, often featuring instruments like violins, pianos, and flutes.
sentence: I enjoy listening to classical music while working to help me focus.我喜歡在工作時聽古典音樂，幫助我集中注意力。Attending a live performance of classical music can be a truly magical experience.參加現場古典音樂表演可以是一次真正神奇的體驗。

definition: Permission; granting, conceding, or admitting
sentence: I receive a weekly allowance from my parents to spend on snacks and other personal items.我每周都從父母那裡拿到零用錢，用來買零食和其他個人物品。My parents increased my allowance after I got a part-time job.我找到一份兼職後，父母提高了我的零用錢。

definition: She resides by herself without others in the same household.
sentence: She lives alone, so she enjoys the peace and quiet.她獨自一人，所以她享受著寧靜。Despite living alone, she is very independent and self-sufficient.雖然她獨自一人，但她非常獨立和自給自足。

definition: A day that is an exact number of years (to the day) since a given significant event occurred. Often preceded by an ordinal number indicating the number of years.
sentence: We celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary with a romantic dinner by the beach.我們以在海灘上舉行的浪漫晚餐來慶祝我們的十周年結婚紀念日。The company is offering special discounts during its anniversary sale.公司在週年慶期間提供特別折扣。

definition: An annual publication; a book, periodical, journal, report, comic book, yearbook, etc., which is published serially once a year, which may or may not be in addition to regular weekly or monthly publication.
sentence: The school's annual sports day is always a highly anticipated event among students and teachers.學校每年一度的運動會總是學生和老師們期待已久的活動。The library holds an annual book fair to promote reading and literacy in the community.圖書館每年舉辦一次書展，以促進社區的閱讀和識字能力。

definition: A large, powerful storm is getting closer.
sentence: The typhoon is approaching, so everyone needs to evacuate to a safer place immediately.颱風正在接近，所以每個人都需要立刻撤離到安全地方。We should prepare for the worst as the typhoon is approaching.隨著颱風正在接近，我們應該做最壞的準備。

definition: A state in which opposing forces harmonise; equilibrium.
sentence: She managed to find a balance between her work and personal life.她成功地找到了工作和個人生活之間的平衡。In order to maintain a balanced diet, it is important to eat a variety of foods.為了保持均衡的飲食，重要的是要吃各種不同的食物。

definition: A strong personal conviction or faith in a particular religion or set of religious teachings.
sentence: His religious belief is deeply rooted in his family's traditions.他的宗教信仰深深扎根於他家族的傳統。She explores different cultures and religions to understand various forms of religious belief.她探索不同的文化和宗教，以了解不同形式的宗教信仰。

definition: Belief in a spiritual or metaphysical reality (often including at least one deity), accompanied by practices or rituals pertaining to the belief.
sentence: She practices her religion devoutly and attends church every Sunday.她虔誠地信仰她的宗教，每個星期天都會參加教堂。Many people find comfort and guidance in their religion during difficult times.許多人在困難時期會在他們的宗教中找到安慰和指引。

definition: A movie that is not interesting or exciting to watch.
sentence: The students fell asleep while watching a boring movie in class.學生們在課堂上看一部無聊的電影時睡著了。I regret spending money on a boring movie that had no plot.我後悔花錢看了一部毫無劇情的無聊的電影。

definition: Feeling uninterested or lacking excitement.
sentence: I was bored during the long meeting.在那場漫長的會議中，我感到無聊。I was bored, so I started doodling on my notebook.我感到無聊，所以我開始在筆記本上亂畫。

definition: A narrative that captures attention and engages the reader with its content or plot.
sentence: The teacher told us an interesting story during class today.老師今天在課堂上告訴了我們一個有趣的故事。I always enjoy reading an interesting story before going to bed.我總是喜歡在睡前讀一個有趣的故事。

definition: I have a desire to learn about and appreciate creative works.
sentence: I am interested in art because I find it to be a beautiful form of expression.我對藝術感興趣，因為我認為它是一種美麗的表達形式。In my free time, I like to visit museums and galleries because I am interested in art.在我的空閒時間，我喜歡參觀博物館和畫廊，因為我對藝術感興趣。

definition: Contentment, ease.
sentence: She offered him a hug to provide comfort after his loss.她給了他一個擁抱，以安慰他在失去後。The presence of his best friend was a great comfort during his difficult times.他最好朋友的存在是他困難時期的極大安慰。

definition: She appears sure of herself and her abilities.
sentence: She looks confident in her presentation, making eye contact with everyone in the room.她在演講中看起來很有自信，與房間裡的每個人都保持著眼神接觸。Even though she was nervous inside, she looks confident on the outside.雖然她內心很緊張，但外表看起來很有自信。

definition: She believes in herself and her abilities.
sentence: She has lots of confidence, which helps her excel in her career.她有很多自信，這有助於她在事業上表現出色。Even in challenging situations, she never wavers because she has lots of confidence.即使在困難的情況下，她從不動搖，因為她有很多自信。

word: I'd like to confirm my reservation.
definition: I want to make sure my booking is secure.
sentence: I'd like to confirm my reservation before my trip.在旅行前，我想確認我的預約。I'd like to confirm my reservation for two people, please.我想確認我的預約是兩人，謝謝。

definition: The act of reserving, withholding or keeping back.
sentence: I made a reservation for a table at the restaurant for tonight.我今晚在餐廳預約了一張桌子。She called to make a reservation for a spa treatment next weekend.她打電話預約下週末的水療療程。

definition: Agree to and officially commit to a legal document outlining terms and conditions.
sentence: I need to sign a contract before starting my new job.在開始新工作之前，我需要簽合約。The company and the client will meet next week to sign a contract.公司和客戶將在下週見面簽合約。

definition: Managed or restrained; in a state where things are being handled or regulated.
sentence: The fire is finally under control after hours of firefighting.經過數小時的滅火作業，火勢終於得到控制。The situation seemed chaotic at first, but now it's under control.一開始情況看似混亂，但現在已經控制住了。

definition: Unable to be managed or restrained; chaotic or disorderly.
sentence: The fire was spreading rapidly and was soon out of control.火勢迅速蔓延，很快失去控制。The situation at the party quickly got out of control when the guests started arguing.當客人開始爭吵時，派對的情況迅速失控。
I always sneeze when I'm around cats.當我在貓身邊時，我總是打噴嚏。She couldn't help but sneeze after smelling the flowers.聞到花香後，她禁不住打了個噴嚏。
